title: Amazing maternity experience
body: I've had brilliant care from the Whittington team, beginning to end. The community midwives were great and the team who delivered my baby were also fantastic. I had a totally uncomplicated birth with a great recovery and I really credit the team with that. The follow up care was so efficient and reassuring - my baby was a bit jaundiced and, although they must see this all the time, the midwives were so kind and reassuring. Having a first baby is pretty nerve wracking, I'm so pleased I did it at this hospital. Would recommend it to anyone.

title: Brilliant service 5*
body: Just back from the walk in centre and was only there about 1 hour. Very professional staff and service. Was booked in, seen by Triage Nurse and Practitioner immediately. Tests carries out and prescription give. Can’t praise this service enough as was a bit worried as it was New Year’s Eve.  Thanks to all involved.

title: Fantastic service
body:
Yesterday we were taken to Hereford Hospital having suffered smoke inhalation from a fire on a boat. Just getting in touch to say thank you ever so much for a first rate, friendly and professional service. Happy New Year!
Best regards, Rodger, Karenne and Bamber

title: Just a thank you !
body: Have just left the hospital after havin a mri scan . The 2 men that took care of me were amazing and reassured me the whole time . Thank you for your dedication and the long hours you put in to keep the NHS going at this difficult time ❤️

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

title: Excellent service for unexpected emergency
body:
I walked round to the Surgery at 8.00 a.m. this morning seeking advice on our daughter who was ,and had been ,in a semi conscious state overnight at our house.She lives in aCommunity at Milton Keynes for adults with moderate learning disabilities and receives anti epileptic medication. The receptionist gave excellent advice ,consulting a doctor at the practice to confirm that her advice was correct, All this before the practice was formally open.
Following this advice we spoke to the ambulance service who sent an ambulance who ran all the tests on our daughter and were happy that provided the Guildhall Surgery were able to provide a visit that day , our daughter need not go through a Hospital admission . She was visited by a superb Nurse  Practitioner ,at the time promised ,this afternoon .
our daughter is now back communicating with us and my wife and myself are very grateful for the superb, thoughtful and understanding service we have received

title: Needs MSF or Red Cross assistance
body:
3 hours spent waiting along with approx 10 -15 other patients in a department with staff walking around appearing to do very little while a man in a wheelchair in obviously severe pain kept waiting for pain relief & a young woman trying to lie across 2 chairs to relieve her discomfort.Meanwhile a senior male nurse commenting very audibly & less than compassionately "I don't know why people with long term back pain come into a&e"
3rd world triage in an NHS hospital

readBy.name: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Not helpful
body: Ask for help they put me in for trauma therapy I advice I cant yet as I need help for severe anxiety to which her reply was you dont go I'll discharge you I asked the manager for some help and she didnt Care either said they cant offer me anything one 2 one without group therapy she even told me to go private and then come back to their services  not very professional they dont care about patients at all

title: Great Practice
body:
I find all the staff professional 
And would have no problem recommending this practice to anyone who is looking for a medical practice that can deal with all types of problem healthcare.

title: Wonderful service.
body: My 32 year old daughter, visiting from London today, experienced sudden dizziness and rapid heart rate.  We took her to Brants Bridge and within half an hour she had been seen by a nurse, a doctor and had had an ECG.  All the staff were lovely.  All hail our wonderful NHS!

title: Rude triage nurse
body: I’ve visited regularly due to my daughters long term condition and never had a problem until i came across a new triage nurse. She has got to be the rudest person I’ve encountered at the NHS. I told her my daughters condition which tends to be abbreviated and when I told her what the initials stood for She replied “I know what it is that’s what my years of medical training taught me” well I had the last laugh when in fact she had to then ask me what the medication was I mentioned as she didn’t know clearly they didn’t teach her that too! She really isn’t a Nice person and isn’t suited to be working in a caring profession.

title: Appointment times
body: 2 hour wait time is ridiculous never given a explanation why they are always running late not good when You have things to do and don't what to be spending half your day in hospital being bored and when you have a small child with you

title: Rotor cuff treatment
body:
Superb service from start to finish
Reception: very well informed, professional and thoughtful 
Service of treatment: you wouldn’t get any quicker treatment if you had paid privately 
Called into the practice at 10:00 and had GP appt and steroid injection at 16:00
Thank you to all at Blyth RD Medical centre

title: Absolutely fantastic Surgery
body: I have been with this medical practice now for a couple of years I honestly cannot fault it in any way the staff and the doctors/Nurses  are absolutely fantastic caring and very professional..

title: Lucky to be alive ..no thanks to Mayday hospital
body:
I was left in  Mayday A&E  waiting area for 19 hours with 2 aneurysm's on my brain in the early hours of 20/12..at 7pm they found me a bed and at 9 pm 2 doctors came to my bedside to tell me a 2nd aneurysm had been found  on a 2nd CT scan( my CT scans were at 0500 and 1615 on 21 /12) 

I owe my life  after I was transferred to St Georges on the early hours of 22/12 where the neurlogy team were waiting for me. 
I was advised to contact my family to get to St Georges hospital urgently. 
My son's were told only 30% of people with one aneurysm ever make it to the operating table ...with 2 VERY close to each other my chances of survival were even less . 
Following 5 hours of very risky surgery I woke up in Intensive care with my surgeon holding my hand telling me he had managed to block both bleeds...it is going to be a long road to full recovery but how the hell can Mayday hospital feel a 66 year old patient with a history of strokes not be seen by A&E doctors AFTER  vomiting girls who drank too much and brought in by ambulance and people with sprained ankles? Thankyou St Georges hospital for saving my life ...when Mayday let me down so badly x

title: Remarkable Receptionists
body: The two regular receptionists are an amazing asset to this practice. Nothing is ever too much trouble for them, I’ve always seen impeccable professionalism from them both. I’m truly thankful for their patience, empathy and having that ‘personal touch’, which are rare qualities in this current age.

title: Excellent Service
body:
I saw physio. Gave him brief history. He diagnosed, treated and gave me exercises to do. He explained the problem with the area so well a monkey would have understood him!
Very professional and thorough. Thank you.

title: Extremely professional service
body: Early (approx.6am.) 12th.Dec.2019.I experienced severe breathing problems and other alarming symptoms.My wife rang 111 and a health professional rang back immediately and after a few questions called an ambulance which arrived very quickly (about ten minutes I think)The ambulance team were amazing,assessing very quickly that I had heart problems and whisking me off to Derriford hospital where I was seen immediately and fitted the next day with a pacemaker.I am now recovering well and will be forever grateful to your wonderful ambulance team.

readBy.name: South Western Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust

title: Good Practice
body:
A busy practice with a large number of staff spread over multiple sites, who on the whole are very  pleasant, professional and Polite.  

It can be challenging getting through on the phones if an urgent on the day consultation/ appointment is needed.

title: Great practice
body: I have just visited the surgery and I saw a Dr she gave me a very warm welcome upon my visit. It was so nice to see that she missed the fact that she never saw me for ages. She has always been very helpful to me and understanding. Although I can say the same for all the doctors there. The reception staff are always very polite and helpful. I will recommend this surgery

title: Great Company full of empathy and care
body:
When my husband got diagnosed with a terminal illness I became he’s primary Carer. My children insisted that I need some assistance with this and we decided to meet with a couple of local care companies. Out of the companies we met with Care By Us was who I felt most comfortable with. 

The carers were friendly, caring and empathetic. They put all my initial reservations at ease, as my husbands condition got worse Care By Us support increased, we progressed onto a live in Carer who was an absolute god send, she remained with us for almost 3 years and I couldn’t have been happier with the level of care received. My husband was also very happy, content and comfortable until the very end. 

I would highly recommend Care By Us they have an exemplary personal touch and I’ve always been dealt with in a professional and friendly manner by the carers and the office staff. 

I would like to take this opportunity to thank all Care By Us staff for making an awful situation manageable, I really couldn’t have done it without you.

title: Excellent care, busy practice.
body: The doctors and nurses are all excellent, but it is difficult to make an appointment in the near future. On-line is an efficient system, but same day appointments are almost impossible.  The reception staff are efficient and friendly.

title: Great practice
body: One of the best set of doctors who care and look after their patients. We have been handled with utmost care. Thank you to the wonderful team of doctors at this surgery.

title: No response to online request for appointment
body: Having previously tried to get through on the phone 98 times on one phone and 96 on another with no success. I called the reception for the main building. The receptionist kindly agreed to ask that the practice call me. Firstly an unhelpful and dismissive receptionist from the practice called, she told me she couldn’t book me an appointment and would ask for a DR to call me back. I explained that I would prefer it to be my regular Dr, who has been caring for me and my family for nearly 30 years, her response being she can’t guarantee that despite telling me he was working, following a disco which went round in circles I was told if I feel so unwell I should go to A and E, not helpful at all and rude in my opinion. I received a call back from a Dr, not my regular DR as requested.  But a male I found rude, dismissive and bullying. He frequently spoke over me, would let me explain my symptoms and proceeded to tell me I should have used the online consultation to save time. Well I did some 2 weeks later Re different symptoms and generally feeling unwell, guess what, no response...... I really wish the practice I had been with hadn’t merged with this new one, the staff have no people skills, their cold and dismissive, why can’t I call and get through in the phone, surely dealing with peoples health worries warrants a discussion not feeling in an online form and why no response to filling in and sending the firm. An absolute joke of a practice. Definitely looking for another.

title: “I didn’t “look “like I was in active labour!”
body: I had my baby in September, the day I went into labour (5 days overdue) I was experiencing contractions since 2am but I would say that I was in active labour around 7pm that evening. My fiancé had called the midwives and asked when we should make a move and make our way to the centre, and we was advised to come in to get a check up to see how things were coming along as my contractions where very frequent. As I arrived the contractions got worse, and they where more frequently. This is where (in my opinion) the clinic went wrong. As I was getting assessed by a midwife I was told that I was 3-4 cm dilated, and this is usually around the time that I would be admitted. The midwife then asked me if I wanted to stay and be admitted or go back home where I can be more comfortable and wait a little longer and return when labour was more active. I told the midwife that I would like to stay and be admitted as I was in a lot of pain, and knew my baby was on the way, so going home and making my way back would only delay things and make me more stressed out and scared. I thought I was given a choice seeing as I was asked what I would like to choose to do, however the midwife had left the room, spoke to her manager, and came back to me, and told me that they think I should go home and come back later. I do not understand why I was asked just to be told what to do. What is even worse, is the fact that the reason why I was sent home was due to me not “looking like” I was having the type of painful contractions that indicated I was in active labour, so they assumed I would be fit to go home as I was probably exaggerating my contractions seeing as this was my first baby and I didn’t know anything. Needless to say my water broke in the car on the way home, I had to turn around and return, and I gave birth to my baby an hour later! I can’t fault the midwife I was assigned when I arrived back, she was very caring, made me feel super comfortable and helped me immensely during and after labour. However, the same midwife that told me to go home and who wrote the reason for this decision in my notes was that I didn’t “look like I was in active labour“, was the exact same midwife who gave me a tour of the clinic earlier on in my pregnancy, in which she explained their procedures yet failed to follow through when it came to my situation. I understand that many pregnant women deal with labour pain differently, some women feel to express their pain vocally and I totally understand that, yet when I was trying to keep calm and contain myself I didn’t “look like I was in active labour”. This ruined my experience at the practice sadly, I was very stressed out and scared as I returned back to the clinic to have my baby, I didn’t have time to get undressed, or even get settled properly. It was all a rush due to the midwife who assessed me. If a woman says her baby is coming, then believe her that her baby is coming! She will know, whether it’s her first baby or not!

title: Excellent Care
body: I need a colonoscopy every 3 years and frequently go to the NGH.  Just had my last one in the Bev Stokes day surgery unit where the entire experience was excellent.  I was booked in at 12 and seen straight away by the consultant and the anesthesiatist.  I was on the table within the hour.  Very caring staff in recovery and post-op unit who looked after me and kept me well informed. Now at home recovering 2 days after.  Thank you so much for your expert and professional care and making sure I'm cancer free!

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: Trying to get better
title: St Helens Home Treatment Team
body:
After being under St. Helens home treatment team quite a few times this year after having multiple hospital admissions to an inpatient ward. I contacted them when I was in a crisis on Saturday.  
I am under St. Helens recovery team and they only work week days until 5pm so out of hours I have been told to ring the home treatment team should I be in a crisis.  
I rang them approximately 10.30am where a lady answered and after me asking would it be possible for someone to come out and see me today she asked why. I can’t discuss much in my home environment therefore I just explained that I don’t feel safe and have urges to end my life but I want to prove that I am wanting help and reaching out.  
She got my details up on their computer and said -oh yes I recognise your name. We are not a crisis service and you can’t just expect us to drop everything and fit you in when our staff have appointments booked in.  
This made me feel so guilty for even ringing and for reaching out for help. I was then questioning why I even rang them. I told them -I’ve been told by my care coordinator to contact you should I be in crisis and the home treatment team know me’-she raised her voice and now was shouting at me very abrupt saying -you have to have have been referred by your care coordinator and because you are not under us we won’t be coming out to see you.  
I felt completely hopeless and the urges were so much stronger. I had also only been out of an inpatient unit just short of a week when this took place.  
I then found myself crying to this lady on the phone begging her for help. She then said we might be able to send someone out at 12 but we might not. If you get a call in between now and 12 then it’s to say we can’t see you but if you don’t someone will be put’.  
I was very greatful to have someone possibly coming out but I still felt like such an inconvenience and a burden on everyone which was due to how I was spoken too in a moment of crisis.  
12 o’clock came, then 12.30 then 1pm and still nobody had turned up to see me and I had no phone call. I am an extremely anxious person so waiting for someone heightens these feelings which home treatment know. I also understand there is sometimes a perfectly reasonable explanation as to why they are late such as they had a crisis at their last appointment or the traffic etc.  
I rang home treatment team just to see if someone was still coming and they said we have no idea why nobody hasn’t turned up yet give them a bit longer which I did and still nobody was here. Due to my anxiety I rang again and cancelled the call out because i was getting extremely worked up and distressed just sat waiting and watching for them from a window. They never batted an eyelid at the fact I said I was suicidal and was so distressed over the phone and was happy for me to be left.  
This isn’t the first time something like this has happened with St. Helens home treatment team and now I have completely lost all trust in them and probably wouldn’t contact them out of hours now should I find myself in another crisis. They made me feel so invalid and worthless. No service or professional should make you worse and be so inconsiderate at a time of desperation.

readBy.name: North West Boroughs Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: Still waiting for an appointment
body: My husband was having treatment for his Glaucoma - his last appointment was not held as there were too many people waiting for treatment. He was told that a new appointment would be arranged - but he is still waiting. WHY?

readBy.name: St Helens and Knowsley Hospitals NHS Trust

author: jomishka
title: the care i received was faultless
body:
I was only in for Day Surgery but I have to say the care I received was faultless.  
All the nursing and surgical staff were friendly, reassuring and kept me informed of what to expect and when things would happen which is very important as a patient. The ward was very busy but efficiently run and spotless.  
I just wanted to extend my thanks to the staff for making my day as stressless as possible.  
Thank You.

author: Ritch87
title: can't thank the team enough
body:
My daughter was admitted to the Neonatal Unit in December 2019. She was initially admitted to HDU but within 5 minutes was transferred to ICU.  
I was immediately put at ease by two wonderful nurses - Kirsty and Eilidh. Their kindness, compassion along with their knowledge will never be forgotten. They took the time to explain to my husband and I the concerns they had regarding our daughter and how they were dealing with this in the immediate and long term.  
During our stay in the unit we were never made to feel as if we were occupying too much of the nurses time with our questions or concerns.  
The doctors and nurses spent significant time with us explaining our daughters condition along with treatment plan. They were sympathetic to our worries and also to our emotional state with one child in neonatal and 2 children at home.  
Dr Cox along with Consultant Dr Munro provided detailed explanations of our daughters condition and never at any point rushed us. They were both informative but sensitive to the emotions of a new mum.  
During our time in the unit we experienced kindness and compassion at all times. Until last week we have never had any experience of the unit. In all honesty, it's a placed where you wish you will never need the services but should you ever be in a position that they are required, the team within the unit are the best you could ever hope for.  
There are a number of inidivudals with whom we were in contact with during the 5 days who provided exceptional service.That said, anyone we came in contact with treated us with the same care, attention and compassion and we couldn't be more grateful.  
Grace - new to the unit but her compassion with parents will serve her well in the unit.  
We can't thank the team at Aberdeen Neonatal enough. Their kindness will never be forgotten in one of the most worrying and anxious times.

title: High Quality Practice
body: I have been using the same NHS GP at the Chawton Park Surgery for some years now.  He is in my opinion very competent, kind, attentive and very helpful.  This is one of the best NHS surgeries out there and the GP I see in particular is outstanding.  Top marks to a GP who is doing an outstanding job.  Thank you!

author: RayFaeTroon
title: Chest Pains at 3am in the morning
body:
I was awoke to severe pain on right side of chest and arm. After 4 sprays GTN my wife caĺed 999. Ambuance arrived swiftly, and the guys attended to me well.  
At the hospital, I was met by 6 folk who quickly settled me in and had the blood results back very quickly. You do get the names introduced but can never remember them all.  
I did get offer of refreshment eventually, which was well received. My treatment was explained to me all throughout.  
My wife was with me and was offered some lunch too. The soup was delicious! I was offered another.  
My 12 hour blood test was just a few minutes after 3pm, and nicely taken. Hoping for an all clear and to go home with maybe follow up as to the cause.

author: Dmcl
title: caring and professional staff
body:
I was admitted to the labour ward at Aberdeen maternity hospital in August this year. I was to be induced, 12 days over with my first baby..after an unsuccessful induction I was taken to theatre for an emergency c section.  
I'm writing to share what a positive experience we had. Every member of staff we encountered from admission through to discharge the next day were caring and professional. In particular the theatre staff who delivered our wee boy safely, looked after me and talked us through every step and made the whole experience very special.  
Thank you all for the amazing work you do daily.

author: TrickyMac
title: Out of hours.
body:
After suffering a wheezing and tightening chest most of New Year’s Eve day I called 111. I was given an appointment to call with the out of hours. I was met punctually at the door and taken into one of the exam rooms by Nurse Fiona and accompanied by a trainee nurse. Swift diagnosis and rapid treatment sorted the issue very quickly.  
I just wish to pass my thanks onto Nurse Fiona for her professionalism and very pleasant manner. She is both a credit to herself and your organisation. Nurse Fiona is a prime example of what makes our nurses the best in the world.  
Thank you again.

title: Prefer Queens fir my checkup
body: Heart patents should not be mixing with normal patients who have colds and sneezes. They should be separated to avoid cross infections.

author: Nervous male
title: Couldn't fault the care or service provided
body:
Went in for an operation for cataracts in December.  
Couldn’t fault the care and service provided from the nurses, the two anaesthetist and the surgeon.

title: Poor Care
body: Referred by gp to go to surgical emergency unit as I was suffering from severe back and abdominal pain accompanied by high heart rate and temperature. I spent almost 8 hours In the department and was given various tests which showed I had inflammation of abdominal and chest cavity.I was eventually seen by clinical surgeon and examined and even though I was clearly in pain still and he didn't know exactly what was wrong with me said I could go home, no mention of pain management whatsoever. I eventually made it to my car in sever pain and got home and spent a sleepless night in the worst pain I have ever encountered feeling totally let down by hospital.

readBy.name: Wirral University Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Consistently awful at treating mental health
body: I've been going to this GP for about 4 years now for various mental health problems (anxiety, depression and suicidal thoughts, eating disorder). In my honest opinion, most of the staff here do not seem to have the tact and sensitivity required to treat such illnesses. There is only one GP here that I feel does but unfortunately it is extremely difficult to book an appointment with them. In fact, I was recently told by reception that you can no longer book appointments in advance with said GP, and that you can only book them on the day. I would absolutely not recommend this GP for people seeking help regarding mental health.

title: Fully Recommend
body:
I can fully recommend this hospital from start to finish. I was treated with care, dignity, courtesy and consideration throughout, from all who looked after me. The standard of the hospital is extremely high on all accounts. 
I would like to thank them all, especially the surgeon who I feel has given me my life back.

title: Fantastic efficient staff and services
body: Got to see on call doctor at 11am on the Saturday was then given fantastic reassurances and loads of tests to be actually in the theatre by 7pm. Really great care after on Ward 14 during the night with more meds and was able to leave by 4pm Sunday - job well done and a massive thankyou to everyone. To say how stretched and busy everyone was you always felt important. Thank you

title: Why make appointment
body: Rang 111 discussed symptoms was offered appointment at pallion walk in centre two separate desks one for 111 appointments one desk for walk in, but seen in order of arrival with the walk in people so what is the point of appointments I asked the receptionist and she said you tell me having an appointment won't get you up the list any quicker well if that's the case why waste my time ringing 111 to get appointment when I could just go to walk in and sit for 4 hours that's how long I waited even though I had appointment for 1pm , bunny hill and grindon over the years I have attended and appointments meant exactly that you could be 10 - 20 mins late to see the Dr if it was running late the clinic but never 4 hours, so be warned you make appointment but you only going to sit with the rest of people in walk in, don't get me wrong saw lovely nurses and doctor but the system is crazy

title: Amazing staff
body: My son had elective ENT surgery yesterday and the care we received from walking through the doors in waterfall house ward 17 to leaving the surgical Day unit was excellent. As a sister in the NHS I know the limits and constraints of an underfunded and overstretched health service. Despite this every staff member we met did their job, with skill, compassion, kindness and dedication. I was terrified and anxious even though it was a minor op but everyone explained everything and put my mind at ease. Special mention to Batman’s mom (the nurse on ward 17) ENT consultant and Registra, consultant anaesthetist and the lovely HCA on Surgical day unit who looked after us. Thank you all

readBy.name: Birmingham Women's and Children's NHS Foundation Trust

title: So fortunate to be a patient at this practice
body:
My sister and myself have been a patient of our GP for many years now, had to visit the practice this week, and within hours I was at the QMC having blood tests, and further referrals to follow.
We are back for a follow up appointment later this week, I never feel rushed when visiting, and always come away feeling reassured.  So fortunate to have such a good doctor.

title: Service
body: The staff in dybal ward and doctors and nursing staff looked after my wife so well could you please say a BIG THANK-YOU from the both of us to all who was involved in her treatment

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust (2)

title: Cornerstone self referral physiotherapy
body: Very happy with the support that I received from my physiotherapist. My backpain has been resolvedc and I will carry on with the exercises

title: Very quick and efficient
body: Easy to park, no waiting time, fantastic service. Very pleasant experience. Would highly recommend .

title: Splendid care
body:
Day case unit; friendly & caring. In recovery theatre nurse was fantastic!
Overall, an experience which no-one looks forward to was made almost stress-free. Thanks.

title: Reliable and efficient practice
body: The GPs are always kind and efficient. They offer all sorts of practical help. I have never felt rushed even when the issues to be discussed have not been straightforward.

title: Poor service
body: Visited on three occasions in December had to settle for seeing a nurse , no doctor availiable given the same diagnosis each time the flu.By the 29th felt that ill had to go to hospital were it was discovered it was a water infection which was NOT checked at the surgery and being diabetic i would have considered this one of the first things that should have been looked at.

title: Fantastic saved my life
body: I had a sudden cardiac arrest last jan and was brought here, in may I was back for valve repair. The staff and surgeons are exceptional. The whole building is allot newer and cleaner. I really recommend this place .

title: Excellent care.
body: From first appointment, various procedures then surgery followed by excellent after care each and every member of the NHS have been excellent. Thank you.

title: Wonderful Care
body:
Thank you so much to all the doctors and nurses involved in my treatment and care.  I fell and broke my hip, in the road, in Kendal.
The paramedics were so professional, but also very caring.  The team who carried out my surgery were amazing.  Every stage was explained to me.   The anaethmatist and the surgeon did such a good job.  The nurses worked so hard, and were so kind to me.  It was also that very hot spell we had in July.  The ward was extremely hot. I do hope perhaps more fans could be supplied if it happens again.  I was melting just laying there.  My main concern was for the nurses, they were doing a lot of hard work, changing bedsheets, generally running back and forth and caring for all the patients.  Even taking those who could to have showers and to wash our hair. The lady who came in each day to help the nurses was lovely, always 
had a smile, but quietly got on with her job.  The lady with the tea trolley also was smiley and had kind words for everyone.
THANK YOU ALL SO MUCH.
I am making good progress.  I am just sorry it has taken me a while to thank you all.  But the thank you is sincere and heartfelt.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Morecambe Bay NHS Foundation Trust

title: Could be more helpful
body: I had a neck and shoulder muscle injury from a fall and feel that the doctor should have recommended that a muscle massage would have helped with healing. Other than that I had a good experience.

readBy.name: Doncaster and Bassetlaw Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic surgery
body: Just managed to get an appointment at 5pm within 20mins on New Year’s Eve for my little boy who isn’t well. Luckily he’s tucked up in bed now rather than in an urgent care centre with the treatment he needed. thank you all the staff. Wonderful Practise.

title: Cannot praise the GP enough
body: I got an emergency appointment on 27/12 and was really happy with the care given to me. The GP could not do enough for me she was very caring and attentive. Concerned for my wellbeing she didnt rush me my 10 minute appointment ended up being 30 minutes and Within 90 minutes I was on the SAU at St James's . My thanks go out to the GP concerned.

author: Mrs ROB
title: Attendance at a&e
body: I attended a& e with an ankle injury and the care I recieved was fantastic, the staff were very professional, polite, friendly and knowledgeable and I was seen and treated very quickly. Thank you.

readBy.name: Surrey and Sussex Healthcare NHS Trust
Digestive Diseases Centre, Royal Sussex County Hospital

author: liberatorpp65
title: NHS borders emergency services
body: I fell down the stairs and split my head open after a few drinks on Hogmanay . The ambulance men Steve and Daniel were brilliant, both so patient and kind. Really non judgmental after such a silly thing to do. They called and asked nurse practitioner Andy to come and see my wound which he stapled in my house so I didn’t need to go to BGH. They must have been with me for around 2 hours. I can’t fault the service I received and I am really thankful to all 3 of them for their help and professionalism.

title: So Caring and Organised
body: Everycare Central Surrey have looked after my father for six years now. In that time we have experienced their skill at caring for and bringing my father back to good health and happiness. They combine excellent, genuine care with continued organisational excellence which I believe is not easy to strike such a great balance. I couldn't recommend the care manager and his wonderful team more highly .

title: Cancer prescriptions
body: I have brought this issue up before we attended the cancer department yesterday our appointment was on time but then it was a forty minutes wait to be given the prescription then we had the walk to the main building to pick it up which was another twenty minutes wait,for a cancer patient it is so tiring by the time we got home what could have been an hour it turned into two hours plus.l am sure there has got to be a better way to get the medication.That is the only down side the staff are brill I would give ten stars if I could but the prescription walk needs to be addressed.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of North Midlands NHS Trust

title: Normally avin a moan, but not today.
body: Normally having a moan and I have been known to moan about the Manor. I went in with my Dad suspected of having Sepsis. He was seen by a doctor in 30 minutes and on a drip.  Within an hour he was on Antibiotocs, steroids, had a,  I think, a CT scan, results from his blood had come in. They made him a cup tea and will be keeping him. Thank you to those lovely caring people. For the record I'm normally complaining because the cuts compromise the service. Thank you NHS you are amazing. If we ever lost them hundreds of years from now it will be remembered as the lost civilization.

title: SUPERB TREATMENT
body: I have had treatment & care at Dorset County Hospital Eurology  and have now had the all clear, Staff are Fantastic & Caring and very Professional in all aspects, I really can't thank them enough .  Many thanks to you All.

readBy.name: Dorset County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Appalled by treatment
body:
My doctor ordered me to attend A&E on nye due to terrible pain after ankle injury , I struggled to get there on arrival booked in and my doctors actions were questioned as to why I was there ( I had been crying in pain all eve and could not stand !) as I’d had X-ray day before showing no broken bones . He wanted it looked at again for possible major soft tissue injury or hidden bone issues etc .
When I was called into the triage the male nurse was rude to me showed me my X-ray and said no breaks that’s that .
Which I agreed but couldn’t understand the pain .they xrayed other parts and no breaks .i tried asking if it could be ligament damage etc , as I’ve been crawling round my house unbelievable nasty pain / he was unsympathetic spoke to me like a child . Said I was 40 so ought to know how to use crutches when I tried ( never had to use any in my life ) I wish I had never gone there now .
My gp was trying to help me and after being there on nye I felt exhausted and belittled and uncared for . 
I’m sorry I inconvenienced you with my pain .
In the future I will stay at home .
My pain has continued today I couldn’t even move to get myself out of bed this morning .
I hope for the hospitals sake they are correct and that this is just a “ bruise “” and heals soon as of my 40 years of life and having a child I’ve never had this type of pain before and I’ve had many of strained ankles in my 40 years too I forgot to add . 
So Thankyou for looking at it but I can’t thankyou for putting me down and making me feel terrible and I really hope I don’t have to return and see the fracture clinic . 
Happy new year

title: Absolutley ridiculous!!
body:
First of all I dont usually do this sort of thing but feel people need to be warned before joining this practice.

Looked online this evening (01/01/2020) for an appointment for my partner, its not urgent so doesnt need to be seen on the day ... i was very shocked when I saw that the next available appointment wasnt until 28th January .. nearly a month away seriously!? This is ridiculous practice

Another incident I had a couple of weeks back, my son woke up unwell so rang the surgery for an appointment to be told they had no appointments as the doctors had rang in sick, as previously worked in a go surgery I know they get locum doctors in to cover sickness so I asked are you not getting any locum doctors in to cover? To which the receptionist replied 'no' .. just no 

Personally this surgery is not good enough. Only registered at this surgery as we moved house and had to leave our other surgery which was fantastic! 
Would not recommend this surgery

title: Always late
body: Take a half day if you have an appointment. Appointment times are never kept to wait, could be in the waiting room for an hour

title: Fantastic Practice
body: Such a Professionally run practise. It runs like a business but never loosing its kind and caring nature. The team at Richmond Road are incredible. The doctors, nurses and receptionists are truly the best! I feel very lucky indeed to be a patient at this surgery.

title: Brilliant
body:
Brilliant service all round by everyone who dealt with my partner after he was badly bitten by a stray cat. The A&E doctor was very caring, explained how serious this was , as my partner had cellulitis/ infection that was spreading and making him very unwell. This wonderful doctor made him( a very reluctant patient) realise he needed treatment in hospital and arranged for him to be seen by a specialist at Broomfield Hospital.  Can't thank all the staff at Queens enough and thanks to this amazing doctor he is on the road to recovery in hospital. Thank you all for doing an amazing job.
My only criticism was the amount of patients and relatives that were eating in the area and the amount of rubbish on the floor ie food containers , cups etc, this was disgusting but I blame the people who ate and drank these items. Personally I don't think food should be allowed in these areas

Also we had to sit in the corridor on the low windowsill as all seats occupied.

readBy.name: Barking, Havering and Redbridge University Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Efficient service
body: My son was seen with an injured foot in the Urgent Treatment Centre within 5 minutes of arrival, reviewed by a doctor and discharged within 10 minutes. We were home and back within 30 minutes with great piece of mind on a public holiday. Amazing service. Thank you

title: No antibiotics
body: What's the point of having an urgent care with no antibiotics on a bank holiday? was treated today here and was told I need to take antibiotics right away, however the nurse asked me to go to Reading Hospital (A&E) for the antibiotics. When I arrived in Reading, they told me a nurse will need to see me again since the prescription can't be used there. The process is broken. Bracknell Urgent Care Centre should provide at least a medication dose.

title: First class care
body:
Our son was admitted on Christmas Day to ward C31, the staff on this ward really are brilliant! Isaac is only 20 years old and has had a rotton year following removal of his large intestine and a stoma fitted. The nursing staff care, compassion, listening skills and overall attention to their patient, our son, was very much appreciated. The sister on the ward clearly had good management of the ward and was well organise, her support to us as parents was invaluable.
Please pass on our thanks and sincere gratitude to the team who were there for our family in our time of crisis.

readBy.name: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust

title: great attitude
body:
I visited with my unwell 9 year old. The doctor was very happy and nice, and it really makes a difference. Thanks. 

p.s. this GUI will not accept 01/2020 as a date, which is when I visited. Looks like a bug in the code.

title: Refusal of prn meds
body: I am in bed in the unit while writing this the date is 01/01/2020 at 23.26 I am voluntary patient and I aren’t sleeping well. I have requested my sleeping pill that’s on prn and they have refused to give it despite the fact I have tried relaxation techniques!! Nurses are abusing their post and going too far!! Why write up a PRN med and refuse it? I am not psychotic

title: Great staff
body:
While attending a&e at 12am on 30/12/19 my daughter was being sick in the waiting room she was very scared and a lovely older man who was cleaning rushed over and calmed her down and was extremely helpful and cleaned it all up straight away. 
We was waiting over 6hrs to be seen but staff were all friendly.

readBy.name: North West Anglia NHS Foundation Trust

title: Genuine caring teams
body:
I brought my son into A&E as he was complaining of chest pains. It was early evening on NYE. Everyone from the receptionist to the nurses, assistants and doctor who saw him were friendly, efficient, professional and genuinely caring.  

Witnessing some of the really difficult patients they were having to also treat, makes me think they all deserve a medal! 

It was a scary time but we were so reassured. A credit to the NHS.

readBy.name: Sandwell and West Birmingham Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Very Accommodating Practice
body: My wife and I visited on New Years Eve after having a consultation at a local Pharmacy regarding Vaccinations for our honeymoon. We were told that the vaccinations that we needed would cost over £200, we dropped by the practice at 16:45 and checked to see if any of the Vaccinations were available on the NHS. To our surprise all of the ones we needed were on the NHS, we asked to book an appointment as we were close to our departure date and didn't know if we were too late. The receptionists were extremely helpful in checking with the nurse to see if they had the vaccinations in stock and then came through to say that they could do them straight away. We were surprised and very grateful that we could get them done straight away and at no cost. Thank you so much to all the staff involved.

title: Useless Online Appointments
body: To run an efficient surgery and utilize the whole of the time a GP is present, any cancelled appointments should be displayed online immediately so that anyone needing one can take advantage. The only appointments available online at this surgery are for Saturday mornings 'extended hours' and this needs to be changed. Of course, if appointments are cancelled and no one takes them up, doctors can go home early but they wouldn't do that, would they? Other local surgeries have appointments becoming available at all times of the day almost as soon as they become cancelled. This is how it should be with doctors fully occupied for the hours they are hired, especially nowadays when two-thirds are only part-time due to the high intake of females with families.

title: Amazing service
body: I was seen to relatively fast considering they have more severe patients. My needs were met and the doctors are extremely helpful. This is the most organised and loving GP which deserves full respect.

title: Great Practice
body:
I went recently and it was a great experience. Quick, friendly and easy.  

Doctor was very informative and professional and messaged the Kinton pharmacy so I could pick up my medicine immediately.

author: Izzyabass
title: Rampton pd Oscar's
body:
This is a story on behalf of my brother who's on hambleton ward on the 4th of december 2019 he attended a pd Oscar's event he was nominated for 2 which he was very grateful for and it was very thoughtful from the people that put him in. He did win 1 and he was gutted that he didn't win the other one he said it was a lovely evening with good company they had food and drinks and it was a very special night.  
I would like to thank the occupational therapists and would like to thank the managers and the crb staff for the planning and presentation. I'm sure next years will be just as good but hopefully he will be in a medium secure on the way home to his bigger picture with the people he loves and cares about. All take care and thankyou very much.

title: Great Practice
body: All the staff were superb, putting you at your ease prior to the operation. I have already recommended you to a friend

title: No emergency appointments
body: About 3 weeks ago I had a viral infection with a cough.  I did not see the need to see a GP.  I don't often ask to see a GP.  The cough eased.  Then 3 days ago the cough got really bad again.  I also developed a temperature.  So I phoned the surgery   feeling quite I'll.  Surprise, surprise.  No appointments.  Phone at 8am tomorrow.  This was at lunchtime.  I had to wait until 6.30 pm before I could call 111 and was seen out of hours. My son drove me there. I was told that I had crackling in right lung indicative of a chest infection and given antibiotics.  I have now developed pain on my right side.  Kept me awake last night.   So phoned surgery.  Just wanted advice.  Oh no.  Nothing and nobody available.  Told that if I come to surgery tomorrow morning at 8 I can make an appointment or phone (by the time you get through appointment tend to be gone).  I pointed out to the receptionist that I was feeling too fatigued to do this.  That I had eaten around 6 dry biscuits and one tin of soup in the past 3 days.   This used to be a good surgery, but since the merger you will have to be on death door (even then an appointment is doubtful) or plan your illness well in advance.  I will certainly not recommend this health centre to anybody any more.

readBy.name: NHS Bristol, North Somerset and South Gloucestershire CCG

title: Exemplary practice in every way
body: I have several times used the duty doctor service this month feeling that being able just to talk through a problem was probably all I needed though reassured that if the doctor thought otherwise I would also be seen. On all 3 occasions I was rung within an hour and was able to discuss symptoms, solutions and medication with a doctor who was helpful, knowledgeable, kindly and what I appreciated almost as much as his expertise, took great trouble to be reassuring. On one occasion after he had suggested I have a precautionary blood test, I received a text from him the following morning at 9 am to say that the results were normal, thus making all the difference to my Xmas! On another occasion the medication I was prescribed proved to be very effective. I would therefore like to say what a very valuable service I think the duty doctor system is and to express my warmest thanks to the doctors I have spoken to. It is neither possible nor necessary to have a face to face meeting much of the time. Knowing there is the possibility of talking the problem through on the phone with a sympathetic expert is the perfect solution. Thank you all.

title: Lifts & Toilets
body: There are a number of lifts not working.  I have had to attend suite 3 twice in the last month and on both occasion the lifts were not working nearest to the area I needed to go.  You have to walk further which can be chore when you have a leg in plaster and are using crutches.  Also on the 1st floor there are a number of toilets not in use for gentleman.  The one nearest suite 3 is out or order so I was directed to an area up a long corridor in the orange zone and one of the toilets there is also out of order.  This is disgraceful.  The hospital is in terrible condition and basic amenities are not available.  Why put the fracture clinic on the 1st floor and then make it hard to get to.

title: Mistruth or disinformation?
body:
Told verbally by a practice manager that they amalgamated with Malling health 4 weeks ago.  when we all know it been several months. 
Their own website states prebookable appointments, but then when you call they say there are not. 
"Appointments are bookable on the phone or at the desk at 08:00 each morning, we have pre-bookable appointments and on the day appointments."
Is it too much to treat patients with the care we require, or is telling fibs normal here?

author: Ritch87
title: Midwives worked so hard to get us home for Christmas
body:
I spent 4 nights in Summerfield ward whilst our daughter was in the neonatal unit. I was in a room with one other mother who was post natal and 2 women who were still pregnant.  
This was a very upsetting time for my husband and I during the time our daughter was being cared for in the neonatal unit (which is at the other end of the maternity hospital from Summerfield ward). I would say that care is needed for mothers who are separated from their babies in the neonatal unit. Often post natal checks were missed because of the amount of time spent out of the ward and in the neonatal unit and on some evenings I came and went from the ward without any communication at all. Save for the last two days on the ward, i felt very isolated during my time on Summerfield Ward. During my time in the hospital, I spent very little time in Summerfield ward as I was at the neonatal unit sitting with our poorly daughter, returning only to the ward to express milk for my daughter and to sleep. On the 4th night my daughter returned to the ward with me and the midwives did everything they could to expedite my discharge from the hospital. Unfortunately by this stage I had developed an infection and it looked likely that I may not be able to return home for Christmas. The midwives mentioned below worked with the doctors to help get me home with the rest of my family by giving IV antibiotics for 18 hours followed by oral antibiotics for 6 days at home. Nicola Forster, Sarah and Hannah all worked so hard to get my daughter and I home for Christmas and we are so grateful for their kindness and compassion during a difficult time when I was separated from my daughter in the unit and also from my children at home. There was an individual who was less than helpful during my time on the ward but this has been dealt with on a separate complaint.

title: Uncontactable!
body:
Self Referred to the York IAPT service on the advice of my GP. 
I received a voicemail a couple of days later asking me to get in touch for a telephone assessment. I rang back the number provided but the phone lines are unmanned. How can you respond to a missed call when the lines are unmanned?

I received a letter saying to get in touch or I would be discharged, the letter stated you could arrange appointment Via email.. so I emailed - No response. I filled in the contact form on the website - No response. Left several Voicemails stating I wanted to arrange the appointment via email or have someone ring me back any day after 5pm as I cannot take calls during the normal working day - No response.

In total, I received two missed calls from IAPT, The initial contact,  then a second voicemail which was during the hours I clearly and consistently stated it would not be possible for me to receive a call.

I have now received a letter after my month and a half ordeal stating that I have been discharged from the service as I have failed to make contact. - I rang the two phone numbers provided every day since I made me the referral, I have emailed, filled out the online contact form - Your service is uncontactable. Clearly there is no internal communication. This really is disgusting for a mental health service. People will simply give in seeking help.

readBy.name: Tees, Esk and Wear Valleys NHS Foundation Trust

author: RayFaeTroon
title: My Care after being transferred from Ayr Ambulatory Unit to Station 5
body:
Transferred on New Years Eve to Station 5 where almost immediately a cuppa was offered. My care in Station 5 was excellent throughout with a special mention for Senior Charge Nurse Gail, who took time to explain and converse with me, much appreciated.  
Housekeepers brought my breakfast but as I was late arrival the lady managed to get me Scramble Egg & Bacon. Delicious.  
Consultant Dr McGowan explained to me about my heart attack, and the importance of resuming and maintaining the prescription for life.  
It is not the fault of the nursing staff for my early departure, I cannot settle and as carer for a brain injured person was anxious about them being alone. Thank you to all involved in my care on this occasion.

title: Brilliant care... on Christmas Day!
body: Our daughter received brilliant care from the Nurse Practitioner who saw her on Christmas Day when her virus took a turn for the worse. She was checked extremely thoroughly and the care we received was patient, kind and cheerful, even on Christmas Day. Thank you (once again) Eastbourne DGH - we are so lucky to have you!

title: Best Practice
body: The staff are all very friendly and professional. I have always been greeted with smiles, and you pretty much see the doctor straightaway. Compared to my previous GP experiences, I feel general concern for my well being and care.

title: Un-trained staff, Un-professionalism, Very bus
body:
I never ever get appointment over the phone or even in person. Over they phone always long wait.  Always have to go to walkin centre or A&E.
Receptionist don't even see notes before giving out any information even notes been sent through 111 service and need to seen by doctor on urgent basis. 
I wish i could close this surgery if not than atleast i could change management.

readBy.name: NHS Leicester City CCG General Practice

title: Great Practice
body: Staff very friendly and find there new telephone appointment system a lot easier to use, has saved me having to come to the surgery on multiple occasions

title: Dissapointed
body:
I have been a patient with St Pauls my entire life, but since they merged to form Carlisle Healthcare the service has been appalling. Trying to get through on the telephone takes far too long, often I am on hold for 20 minutes. I recently couldn't get a same day appointment with a doctor, nor could I get a telephone appointment and was told to call the next day. I was in agony, but had to grit my teeth until the next day. Receiving test results has been a nightmare. I have had to call repeatedly to be told a doctor still hadn't looked at the results days after the results were due. I also once had a receptionist tell me that 'No news is good news'... Perhaps not the correct thing to say when the news concerns your health. 
I have also needed travel vaccinations however I was told Carlisle Healthcare do not provide travel vaccinations and I would have to get them privately. I paid £115 for 2 vaccinations, yet the other people I am travelling with managed to get there vaccinations elsewhere for free on the NHS. I appreciate that being able to travel is  a privilege but I am so annoyed that Carlisle Healthcare do not provide this service yet other surgeries do. 
I must add that I have seen some wonderful nurses and nurse practitioners, but the running of this surgery is diabolical when compared to others in the area.
Suffice to say I have now left Carlisle Healthcare...

title: Lyndon 5 bay 5
body: For some reason the date won’t recognise 01/01/2020 I was on this ward with a patient has I’m an HCSW and was with this patient through the night on New Years Eve. There were two staff attending to 11 patients. A few patients were distressed and quite a few needed assistance with their personal hygiene. The two staff on duty couldn’t do enough for the patients on the ward. They spoke with such soft words, gentle and very compassionate. They worked really well together, the team work was superb. I don’t know their names a female and male nurse. It was lovely to see and would like this message to be passed on to them pls. Well done! ❤️ Lyndon 5 bay 5 ❤️

readBy.name: Sandwell and West Birmingham Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Great practise, good staff
body:
My surgery since childhood this practise has always offered sympathetic doctors. 
Reception staff always go above and beyond. I recall requesting an emergency appointment of which there were none available but another person had cancelled within 5mins of their booking time later that day and knowing I only live a few doors down they called me requesting that if I can make it in within the next few minutes I’d be seen.

author: shellie
title: Problems with my mum's care
body:
My mum who was in ward 14 for her kidneys. I went to visit and when i entered the room what a fright i got,my mum was hanging over the bed guard in absolute agony with back pain. One of the visitors told me she had been like that for over 2 hours. She couldn't eat her dinner because of pain and they came back and took her dinner away. I also noticed her pyjamas were different trousers than her top. Her pyjama trousers were lying on the bottom of bed rolled up in a ball and soaking wet as she had had an accident. I had to lift them and put them in my bag.  
I went to a nurse who said she already had her pain killers, I asked mum and she said she hadn't so I went back to another nurse who said she will find out if she had or not. On returning to us i was told another nurse had lifted the pain killers off the floor and put them in the bin. So why not give her more ? It took another 20 min to bring 2 paracetamol that didn't lift the edge of the pain. By this time it was a shift change.  
The next shift came in and within an hour what a difference they had made to my mums pain. She was in pain from 5pm untill the next shift came in, I left at 9.45 pm worry free knowing my mum was in better hands with the nightshift nurses.  
The day shift should be ashamed of themselves

author: Jc5678
title: Staff were busy but still found time to give me a proper update
body:
My Aunt was admitted via A&E, and ended up in Kerensa ward. I live many miles away, so I needed to call to find out how she was bearing up. I am her next of kin. The staff in A&E (majors) and Kerensa were really helpful. They were very busy, but still found time to give me proper information on her state of health and give her excellent care. When she began to improve, their wonderful activity team were brilliant in helping her engage with day to day life each day. A much better option than leaving patients to just sit or lie in bed. When she moved to a community hospital to continue her care, they fully informed me of when, where, and what procedures were in place.  
Contrast this with the community hospital that she went to to convalesce. Whilst she was well looked after, they could not give better information than ‘she’s fine’ or ‘same as yesterday’. She is also being discharged and her care package does not start till the day after she arrives home. She does get some lunch and some meds, but the person who advised me of the discharge couldn’t confirm what arrangements actually were in place as she had not checked them yet. This is disturbing as this is not what you want to hear when someone who is nearly 93 is sent home on her own.  
People always bash busy hospitals, but I feel that the contrast between Royal Cornwall and some of the others is rather dramatic.

author: Renal unit
title: A staff nurse in the renal unit saved my life
body: After a very serious illness staff nurse Tanya in the renal unit in my opinion saved my life. She took charge of my care and transferred me to the QEUH in Glasgow where my treatment continued. Unfortunately I lost part of my leg but still maintain her knowledge skills and care kept me alive. I will always be in her and the renal units debt for the care I received. The most caring unit in the hospital.

author: Geobow
title: A&E, and an admission
body:
I went Crosshouse hospital, Kilmarnoc with my wife after Christmas. We entered the reception area where about 16 people were sitting, possibly only half were customers. I explained that I woke up on Christmas day, 25th with a numbness down one side of my body from the top of my head to my foot. After a whole day I felt that the problem had not gone away and although I was in no pain my wife drove me to the hospital ignoring the 24 call out on line which states I should have called an ambulance.  
Within 5 minutes a nurse called me and I was taken through to be examined in a booth. He was of the opinion I had had a stroke. As my blood pressure was high I was asked to lie on the special trolleys and that a stroke doctor and nurse will be to see me soon. A stroke nurse checked me out, a nurse related to heart conditions checked my heart and the Doctor specializing in strokes came. She booked me in for a Scan on my head. I was then moved to the TIA ward and assigned a bed. All happened within a few hours. Once again I went through tests by nurses and the on duty doctor. The next morning after breakfast, yummy,I went for an ultrascan of my neck. all tests showed my brain to be okay. I was later discharged that day and informed that They would book me in for a MRI scan in a few weeks. I still have the symptoms but not as bad, have been given medication to take at home.  
Can I say that the staff at the hospital were fantastic, attentive and caring all done with a smile. Thank god we have our Scottish NHS, love you all.

title: Caring staff
body:
My relation was a resident for around 10 years prior to their death in 2019.
The staff were wonderful and caring and made sure we could keep them at home where they died with family around.I would be very happy to recommend this care home to anyone.

title: Headache nurses
body: I’ve been coming here now for 2 years under the specialist nurses and I can’t sing their praises enough! They never rush you and go through every single option and outcome you’ve got, the fact you can ring and leave a voicemail for them at any time and they will ring back to help is just wonderful. Can’t thank the neurology team enough.

readBy.name: Hull University Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust

title: 'Caring' has definitely left the caring profession
body: I used Barnet A&E on 30/31 December 2019.I had a general feeling of illness which ended up with very painful chest and back pain and laboured breathing which worried me because of my existing heart disease.The ambulance crew were great,arrived quickly,did tests,made me feel reassured about what was happening and that I’d done the right thing calling,then suggested I go with them to A&E for further tests.However the first person I encountered at the hospital was a nurse whose first words to me weren’t how was I feeling or what had brought me there.His were actually where I’d come from and on answering he said I could have used a different transport mode.I asked if he meant a bus because I had very bad chest pain and was walking with difficulty, he then suggested a car and at around midnight I wouldn’t have had anyone to ask.Then he suggested a cab not considering that not everyone wants to get in a car with a stranger driver when they feel unwell.Also not all can afford.I also felt that if my situation hadn’t warranted an ambulance they either wouldn’t have sent it or not encouraged me go to hospital with them.I was in terrible pain and called professionals because they are who you’re supposed to in those situations.My comments on his questions were replied with his job was to raise awareness but I was sure his job on a patient’s arrival was to do their observations and tests,not interrogate them on their transport method.He did then put a blood pressure monitor on me and it painfully automatically clamped my arm 3 times whilst he walked off not taking the reading,this was causing so much pain I had to remove it.After I reminded him I was there he came back and did it properly and then other observations.  I then was sent off to wait and another nurse took some other observations including an ECG.It was now 2am and she told me the Dr would see me next.I waited but by 3 I queried this and she said they were very busy so I wondered why she had said I was next.I then waited another 2 hours to 5am to see the Dr.She seemed thorough except at the end she went to sort out a CT scan to check I wasn’t bleeding internally,telling me to wait alone in the room and that she would only be a minute.An hour later she had not returned so I asked nurses outside if they knew where she was,they didn’t,nor do I think they knew I was in the room.After now being alone there for over 6 hours I’d had enough and told a nurse I was leaving.She wasn’t bothered.I rarely use your A&E but every time it's a nightmare,mostly because of what chaos it has become but also the apparent lack of caring in most of the staff.Whilst writing this review I have received a 'Courtesy Call' from your trust about my experience which I would not take part in because giving my details to a stranger who calls me on a unknown number sounds like number one in how to get scammed.If it is genuine you would be better putting money into your on the ground resources than a call centre PR exercise.

readBy.name: Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust

author: jmare33
title: My visit to Emergency at Borders Generak Hospital, Melrose, Scotland
body:
As a visitor to Scotland from Australia, I went to the Emergency Department of Borders General Hospital, Melrose in November last year suffering acute pain in chest.  
The treatment I received in this Emergency Department was absolutely brilliant and first class, and I would like to take this opportunity to commend the hospital and some of the practitioners who treated me on this visit.  
Firstly, Dr Nick Ord was extraordinarily attentive, thorough and compassionate in treating me upon arrival. I didn't have to wait even though the hospital was busy, and his professional interest and his very thorough examination of my symptoms reassured me that I was in good hands.  
Secondly, Dr Jenny Hall in the Acute Assessment Unit, maintained this high level of thorough and complete investigation into my symptoms and I cannot praise her professional approach enough. She also wrote a very detailed report of the treatment received and tests undergone to ensure my Medical Practitioners back in Australia could receive this information.  
Finally Joanne Little (Nurses' Aide) was also very attentive, empathetic and compassionate in her treatment towards both myself and my husband.  
As visitors from Australia to Scotland, we were very impressed with the high standard of care and treatment afforded to us at this hospital.  
I am hoping that this feedback will be forwarded to these personnel who are doing an outstanding job, and to their supervisors.  
We hear a lot of criticism about the NHS, however, in our situation, we have nothing but high praise for the treatment we received.
